intro: Myopsia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, purple berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife. Myopsia mexicana is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and blooms during the warmer months.
